channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Are manufacturing jobs actually special?
item.description: More than half of American workers don't have a college degree. Is manufacturing a ticket for them to the middle class?

item.title: Trump administration moves to cancel remaining federal funds to Harvard

item.title: NPR and Colorado public radio stations sue Trump White House

item.title: Why Japan sees President Trump's tariffs as a 'national crisis'
item.description: Although largely paused, President Trump's tariffs present a major threat to Japan's already flagging economy.

item.title: Analysis of President Trump's comments on Russia, EU tariff delay

item.title: 5/27: CBS Morning News
item.description: Russia launches massive drone attacks on Ukraine; Karen Read trial resumes today after holiday break.

item.title: Controversial US-backed group says it has begun aid distribution in Gaza
item.description: Hundreds of Palestinians collect food from a site run by the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, whose work the UN calls a "distraction".

item.title: What is normal pressure hydrocephalus

item.title: Here’s what a Texas oil executive from DOGE is doing inside the Interior Department
Ancient human fingerprint suggests Neanderthals made art
item.description: A Neanderthal man is believed to have painted a nose on a pebble using red pigment more than 43,000 years ago.

item.title: NPR sues Trump administration over executive order to cut federal funding to public media

item.title: Chinese-owned Volvo Cars to cut 3,000 jobs
item.description: The firm's boss pointed to the "challenging period" faced by the industry as a reason for the layoffs.

item.title: Trump administration seeks to pull estimated $100m in Harvard funding
item.description: Federal agencies will review their grants to Harvard to decide whether they should be terminated

item.title: Man charged over killing of Jordanian pilot burned alive by IS
item.description: Osama Krayem is accused of terrorism and war crimes in relation to the death of Moaz al-Kasasbeh.

item.title: 8 of the 10 inmates who escaped in a New Orleans jailbreak are back in custody
item.description: Authorities say they’ve captured three more of the 10 escapees who broke out of a New Orleans jail, leaving two more on the run.
